snippet: Competition among insurers shows an ability to restrain growth in costs, disproving Republicans’ fear-provoking tale that the Affordable Care Act will drive rates up.
abstract: Editorial holds that moderate rates proposed by health insurers for individual coverage in newly-established health care exchanges discredit Republican alarmist rhetoric concerning the Affordable Care Act; cites data showing healthy competition between insurers in the 19 states where exchanges will be entirely run by federal government.
lead_paragraph: Competition among insurers shows an ability to restrain growth in costs, disproving Republicans’ fear-provoking tale that the Affordable Care Act will drive rates up.

headline.seo: Health Plan Rates Under Obamacare Aren’t So Bad

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
